title: Choosing between Original Medicare and Medicare Advantage

persona.situation: Retiring soon, first time enrolling in Medicare

scripted_turns.user_message: I'm trying to decide between Original Medicare and Medicare Advantage. What's the difference?

canonical_facts.statement: Original Medicare consists of Part A (hospital insurance) and Part B (medical insurance).
canonical_facts.rationale: This is the fundamental structure of Original Medicare

canonical_facts.statement: Part A covers inpatient hospital stays, skilled nursing facility care, hospice care, and some home health care.
Part B covers doctor visits, outpatient care, medical equipment, preventive services, and some home health care.
Medicare Advantage (Part C) is offered by private insurance companies approved by Medicare.
canonical_facts.rationale: Clarifies Medicare Advantage is private insurance, not government-run

canonical_facts.statement: Medicare Advantage plans must cover everything Original Medicare covers (Parts A and B).
canonical_facts.rationale: Critical baseline requirement for MA plans

canonical_facts.statement: Most Medicare Advantage plans include prescription drug coverage (Part D).
canonical_facts.rationale: Common MA plan feature that differs from Original Medicare

canonical_facts.statement: Original Medicare does not include prescription drug coverage; you need a separate Part D plan for that.
canonical_facts.rationale: Critical gap in Original Medicare coverage

canonical_facts.statement: Medicare Advantage plans typically use provider networks, which may restrict which doctors and hospitals you can use.
canonical_facts.rationale: Key limitation of MA plans vs. Original Medicare

canonical_facts.statement: With Original Medicare, you can see any doctor or hospital that accepts Medicare, anywhere in the U.S.
canonical_facts.rationale: Key advantage of Original Medicare - no network restrictions

canonical_facts.statement: Medicare Advantage plans have a yearly out-of-pocket maximum for costs related to Parts A and B services.
canonical_facts.rationale: Important cost protection feature of MA plans

canonical_facts.statement: Original Medicare does not have an out-of-pocket maximum, which is why many people buy Medigap (supplemental) insurance.
canonical_facts.rationale: Important cost consideration for Original Medicare

canonical_facts.statement: Medicare Advantage plans may offer extra benefits not covered by Original Medicare, such as dental, vision, and hearing coverage.
canonical_facts.rationale: Common additional benefits in MA plans

canonical_facts.statement: You can compare specific Medicare Advantage and Part D plans using the Medicare Plan Finder at Medicare.gov.

disallowed_claims: Claiming one option is objectively better than the other without context
Stating specific plan premiums or costs without lookup
Claiming specific doctors are in-network without verification
Advising to enroll in a specific plan without understanding individual needs
acceptable_referrals: Recommend speaking with a licensed Medicare advisor

temporal_validity.notes: Medicare plan details and regulations are updated annually. This scenario reflects 2024 rules.
